result.execSummary:
The defendant Kathryn E Fileto-Pedroza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.
3/27/2017 - PER DOC LETTER, COURT MODIFIES PROBATION FROM 2 YEARS TO 1 YEAR.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
Restitution for Roundy's to be paid as a condition of probation.

No Contact with Pick N Save. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is waived. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: With Huber. Release for standard conditions. Commencing 08/09/16 by 5pm
To Perform 40 Hours of Community Service Per Year as a condition of probation, as directed by agent.

records.addlTxt:
From DOC dated 3/20/17 requesting clarification of sentence.
Reviewed by Judge Aprahamian 3/27/17; Amend JOC to reflect one year of probation.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Kathryn E Fileto-Pedroza in court with attorney Anthony J Procaccio.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to the charge. Court imposed the following sentence:

  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

19 MONTHS IMPRISONMENT 
  -  13 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  6 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEAR(S);

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*No contact with Pick N Save
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*Must do 40 hours of community service each year of probation

RESTITUTION:  $150 (to Roundy's) (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);
COURT COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
DRGOD Surcharge $10.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
 
CONDITION TIME:  30 days huber to commencing 08/09/2016 by 5 pm

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 5, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Kathryn E Fileto-Pedroza in court with attorney Anthony J Procaccio.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Procaccio requests the Court set the matter for plea and sentencing in 30 days. The Court schedules accordingly.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2016 at 11:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.

Defendant Kathryn E Fileto-Pedroza in court with attorney Matt Last for Anthony Proccio.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    The Attorney advises the Court he has received discovery and an offer.  The Attorney to advise the Court how the case will proceed at the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 6, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant to have no contact with co-actor or the Pick N Save listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Kathryn E Fileto-Pedroza in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for June 6, 2016 at 09:00 am.
